ExperienceSummary.Description: William Gaskill is experienced in:  Information Technology (QA and QC); and User Experience (User Research). William Gaskill has 14 years of work experience, with 2 years of management experience, including a low-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 8/1/2019, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 6 months:
	Title: Lead Employee Experience Strategist for Best Buy
Starting on 3/1/2018, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 10 months:
	Title: Lead UX Researcher for Best Buy
Starting on 2/1/2014, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 11 months:
	Title: UX Lead for MakeMusic

Positions.Description:
Innovated and defined processes for user research at Best Buy to include:
• Empathy mapping workshops
• Journey mapping workshops
• Leveraging past persona work to speed time to delivery
• Experience mapping workshops
• Presentations to business and tech partners
• Operationalizing processes on the research and strategy team

Conducted and designed processes for user research to include:
• Stakeholder interviews
• Usability Testing
• Contextual interviews
• Persona Workshops
• Solution software evaluations
• Journey mapping
• Presentations to business and tech partners
• Introduce processes to other researchers

Led and conducted the following user research events for the Personalization Journey team:
• Generative research
• Primary and secondary research
• Contextual interviews
• Persona workshops/co-creations
• Remote and in person user interviews
• Presentations to business leaders
• Coordinating across teams to utilize past learnings

"Operationalized" UX research and expanded it to include strategic product research for the new Klic Marketplace e-commerce application using:
• Contextual interviews
• Customer journey mapping
• UX Pin to document processes interactively
• Presenting processes to improve communication to the strategy and planning team
• Remote user testing of early semi-interactive prototypes
• In person testing of advanced prototypes
• Drove processes on Planning and Strategy Team to operationalize input from SME's and verifying assumptions about future work

Drove B2B e-commerce research efforts and created interactive prototypes to demonstrate parallel design ideas from that research including:
• Heuristic evaluations
• Card sorting
• Persona creation
• Contextual interviews and observations
• A/B testing
• Led a five-country remote and in-person international usability research effort, managing outside vendors in four languages, collating into one accessible report
• Created a corporate style guide, interaction guidelines, collected design patterns which had been tested and proven
• Transformed the product management group's thinking from guessing about users to making evidence-based decisions

Led the research effort for the redesign of a major web-based education product using:
• Heuristic evaluations
• In person usability testing
• Contextual interviews
• Persona creation
• Style guides
• Feeding research findings to designers and developers in a timely and effective manner
• Created and tested a complete interactive prototype redesign of the SmartMusic product which was launched in 2017
•  Helped the UX team grow and flourish with support from vice president of products and supply evidence of which design works best and why
• UX Guidelines were published on SharePoint

• Redesigned the UX for an e-commerce website at a leading fitness company
• Implemented an informal user study methodology to test concepts and collect user artifacts for a major fitness company's C2C e-commerce project
•  Merged best practices of both Agile and User Experience to form a truly lean and less-do-over development environment while delighting the user base through direct engagement at an e-learning company
• Partnered with the University of Minnesota's design program to provide a real world UX experience for students; mentored class groups and spoke at the University several times

• Re-wrote the Standard Operating Procedure for User Centered Design based on Human Factors research and upcoming FDA guideline changes
• Conducted on-site user research and usability testing in hospital, lab and business environments, and reported the findings to the client.
• Designed, developed and tested UI prototypes and iterated Usability Specifications and Design Documents meeting or exceeding government quality standards.
• Evangelized the benefits of usability to the larger internal organization and introduced the IT department to these techniques.
• Participated in the international AAMI Human Factors conference and reviewed documents for use in the international HE 75 standard.


Education, Training & Accomplishments

Achievements: Minnesota Music Awards - Nominated for "Best Horns", 1980
Featured saxophonist on the compilation "Purple Snow: Forecasting the Minneapolis Sound" on Numero records
Design of Fifth Element Solutions process and attending materials, 2001
Dayton-Hudson (Target) Corporation Visual Design Guide GUI Standards booklet and poster, published in 1997
Prudential Preferred GUI Standards booklet, published in 1996

Findings.Message: An email address was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include an email address.
A phone number was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include a phone number.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.

ResumeMetadata.PlainText:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  

Bill has innovated strategic user experience solutions to solve customer problems and design challenges for nearly 30 years.
He has driven to great outcomes in the software and web industries, e-commerce, e-learning, medical systems, on customer/consumer facing and B2B web sites and personal devices.

Highlights of Bill's Experience
• Leading and mentoring UX Design and research teams
• Pioneering UX Strategy in multiple organizations
• Producing unique and valuable insights in user research and analysis of findings
• Driver of best practices in User Centered Design
• Reports and tools which motivate clients to act
• Moderated and unmoderated studies in a diverse portfolio of techniques
• Led studies at dedicated usability labs since 1995
• Ongoing education and interest in design patterns, emerging technologies, project management tools, web analytics remote testing and employee mentoring


Bill has worked in full lifecycle development environments on multiple platforms, including handheld devices, touch screens, kiosks, embedded systems, IT applications, digital manufacturing, music software, and supply chain systems.  He is familiar with and knows when to apply responsive design versus targeted device design.

Bill has led complex UX efforts and user experience teams at multiple engagements and lectured at colleges and universities on the subject of User Centered Design. Bill participated in the usability conference on medical device association called AAMI and contributed in reviewing FDA and international standards for ease of use and product safety.

Many of Bill's projects are complex, data driven applications using diverse platforms to deliver successful user and client-centric solutions.  In addition to his technical accomplishments, Bill enjoys writing and performing music in his spare time.
